context: Good! What movies can I recommend?
I am looking for some good comedies. For the record, I am in no way easily offended, so content isnt an issue.
Ok! Have you seen Jumanji (2017) Kevin Hart is so funny!
No! I saw the original Jumanji (1995) with Robin Williams, but not the new one. Didn't knwo K Hart was in it! will have to check it out!
yes! I loved Superbad (2007) ! McLovin forever!
Its pretty Funy! What about about 21 Jump Street (2012)
I have not seen it. The guy from Superbad is in it, right?
Yes! I cant remember his name.
I think I avoided 21 Jump Street (2012) because I am old enough to have seen the original Tv series and it was terrible lol
Oh lol! It was nice chatting with you! Have a good one.
Do you have one more reccomendation?

context.content: Hello! Do you have a preference for a specific type of movie or genre?
I'm looking for a movie that's thrilling, suspenseful, and emotional all at once. I want something that will keep me on the edge of my seat.
context.feelings: I'm feeling excited to discover new movies today. I hope to find something thrilling, suspenseful, and emotional all at once. Let's see what the recommender suggests.

context.content: I recommend "Psycho (1960)" for a thrilling, suspenseful, and emotional experience that will keep you on the edge of your seat.
Can you tell me more about "Psycho (1960)"? I'd like to know how it fits into the thrilling, suspenseful, and emotional genres I'm looking for.
context.feelings: I'm not sure if "Psycho (1960)" covers all the genres I'm looking for. I need to ask for more details about the movie before making a decision. The recommender is doing a good job, but I need to make sure the movie fits my preferences before accepting the recommendation.

context.content: "Psycho (1960)" is a classic psychological thriller directed by Alfred Hitchcock. It's known for its suspenseful and intense atmosphere, as well as its emotional depth and shocking twists. The film is a masterclass in building tension and keeping audiences on the edge of their seats.
That sounds really interesting. Can you tell me more about the plot and the main characters in "Psycho (1960)"? I want to make sure it aligns with what I'm looking for.
context.feelings: I like the sound of "Psycho (1960)" - it seems to have the thrilling and suspenseful elements I'm looking for. I'm intrigued by the emotional depth and shocking twists as well. I think this recommendation is on the right track.

context.content: "Psycho (1960)" follows the story of Marion Crane, who embezzles money and ends up at the secluded Bates Motel, owned by the mysterious Norman Bates. The film delves into the complex psychology of its characters, creating a thrilling and emotional experience. The main characters, Marion and Norman, are portrayed in a way that adds to the suspense and emotional depth of the story.

Wow, "Psycho (1960)" sounds like it has everything I'm looking for in a movie - thrilling, suspenseful, and emotional. I think I'll go with this recommendation. Thanks for the detailed information! [END]
context.feelings: I like the psychological depth and suspenseful atmosphere of "Psycho (1960)." It seems to fit my preference for a thrilling, suspenseful, and emotional movie. The recommender did a good job explaining how the film aligns with what I'm looking for. I appreciate the detailed information provided.
